name: places/ChIJ19B-m_5YwokR6cAWVsox7bk
formattedAddress: 12 E 44th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 12 E 44th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text:
Terrible management company! Unresponsive, uncaring, unprofessional!! These are some real negligent landlords, my apartment had water damage, structural damage, electrical problems, and more. The worst thing was that property managers were constantly changing. It seemed like they couldn’t employ a steady, reliable, and professional individual who could handle situations as they arose. The last one we dealt with, Serena, was completely unprofessional in both her communication and her handling of an entire kitchen cabinet that fell on us during a rain storm due to water damage. The building I was in was always dirty, with little upkeep. Front door and video system constantly broken. Packages stolen, tenants fearing for their safety, cameras that don’t even work! So many layers of problems that do not get addressed correctly or even at all

All in all, there is a real lack of empathy and concern, so be prepared to deal with problems on YOUR own if you choose to work with them.

originalText.text: I was a tenant of Witnick for 3 years. The apartment was in great condition upon move in; with fresh paint & in the  prefect location for me to have a 15 min commute to work. If I ever had any questions about my lease or if any maintenance needs came up, the office team was efficient to resolve any 911s. The girls were super easy to communicate with, & respectful! would've stayed longer with the Witnick team had I not moved states due to work!

originalText.text: This is the worst management company I’ve come across in 6 years in New York. There are nearly constant problems in my building between pests (cockroaches, spiders, etc.) and general disrepair (front door not locking, which is a big safety issue). If you see Witnick owns the building, run. They’re incredibly negligent landlords.

originalText.text: Communication to them is a DISASTER, RUDE and ARROGANCE.
